attributes.action: Ban the ownership of smartphones and camera phones for children under 16
attributes.additional_details:
Smartphones and camera phones are having a devastating impact on young people in Britain. Children have access to huge amounts of material online, a lot of which is harmful to the child exposed to it. 
There is an epidemic of issues related to internet usage and social media; cyber bullying, issues around sending and receiving sexualised images, unrealistic expectations around body image and appearance. 
Smartphones are damaging the mental and physical health of our children and adolescents.
attributes.background:
I call for the government to ban the sale of, or provision of smartphones, or camera phones to under 16s. 
This would be punishable by a £2000 fine, to the adult who provided the child with the phone. 
I call for the government to make it illegal for under 16s to hold any social media accounts.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign the following petition, which calls for similar action:

Ban the sale, ownership and access to smartphones for children 16 and under
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/714201
